p: In addition to a generally scattered labeling in most brain areas, we found intense Plcg2 RNAScope reaction product in the granule cell layer of the hippocampal dentate gyrus, where the Plcg2 signal co-localizes with the neuronal marker NeuN (Additional file 2d). Rare co-labeling with NeuN was also detected in other subcortical regions (not shown). In summary, Plcg2 transcripts are primarily restricted to microglia cells across the mouse brain, with the exception of the pronounced expression seen in granule cells in the dentate gyrus.
